intro: Coccoloba blanchetiana, commonly known as the pink coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with lobed margins and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
